comments:
some time after I start up eclipse I get the following error in the log.

Mylar 0.4.1

This is a wierd Eclipse startup race condition, but should lead to no bad
behavior.  I will attempt to resolve it this week.
*** Bug 114614 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

Eugene, I streamlined some startup stuff, added exception handling, and haven't seen it
with 0.4.2.  If you ever see this or any other startup exception again please reopen.

I just upgraded to version 0.4.3
running on 

Eclipse Version: 3.2.0
Build id: I20051102-1600 (M3)

The ApplyMylarToPackageExplorerAction error has not occured again, but I am now
seeing two other classes with the same error. see stacktraces below.

Did this cause any bad behavior?  If those classes weren't initialized the filtering shouldn't work on the Package Explorer and selecting elements in the Java Editor shouldn't make them insteresting.  It would also be useful to know whether this happens on every startup, and any other interesting details about your Eclipse setup (e.g. WTP, MyEclipse).

After a little bit more experimentation, you are correct the package explorer was acting very weird.  When I selected a class they were being marked interesting but in order to show them I had to disable filtering and then turn it back on.  After I did that it did seem to start working correctly.  I assume that turning if off then back on would force initialize the classes.  

Also to see if I was getting the exceptions in the log I restarted eclipse its now been running now for about 10 minutes and I have not seem then yet. 

The exception I reported occurred on the initial restart after installing Mylar .0.4.3 into a clean install of Eclipse 3.2 M3 and using an old workspace (the same workspace I have used since I started playing with Mylar)

Also note that after the restart I have not noticed any weird issues or exceptions and all the functionality seem to be working. I guess this could have been a weird initialization issues with an old workspace maybe?

To add some additional detail here is what my eclipse setup looks like.

Eclipse Version: 3.2.0
Build id: I20051102-1600 (M3)

Mylar 0.4.3 (from update site)

ajdt_1.3.0.20051117105200_archive.zip Aspect 1.5.0 M5

wtp-I200511162235.zip (Webtools soon to be 1.0M9)
emf-sdo-xsd-SDK-2.1.1.zip
GEF-SDK-3.1.1.zip
JEM-SDK-1.1.0.1.zip

eclipse-cs (checkstyle plugin 4.0.0 beta 6)
java2html 1.4.1
jadclipse 3.2.0

I will continue to play and also try a few different experiments to see if I can make the issues reappear, if not we can just close the issue again and if they come back and I can find more information I can reopen the issue.

In any case great job as always ;)

After additional testing I have found way to cause the an exception on eclipse startup (every time).    

thread "main" timed out waiting (5000ms) for thread "Worker-3" to finish
starting bundle "org.eclipse.mylar.java". To avoid deadlock, thread "main" is
proceeding but "org.eclipse.mylar.java.JavaEditingMonitor" may not be fully

It has the same stack trace as the other occurrences already in the bug report.

What I have found is this error occurs on startup ONLY if no Mylar Tasks are active when the eclipse environment is shutdown.  if a task is active no Mylar exception occur in the log.  

I also noticed that if a task is active eclipse seem to hang on startup (I would assume this is when it is initializing the Mylar tooling (package explorer, editors, tasks, problems).  if no tasks are active the exception listed above occurs and when the first task is activated the eclipse hang occurs.  After that the Mylar functionality does not seem to be effected.  

If I can help out with testing in any way please let me know and I would be happy to conduct other experiments to try to isolate the problem.

Scott: thanks for the sleuthing, that very helpful.  I've been able to reproduce it once or twice on my machine, but it happens very rarely.  However, I'm going to redo that part of Mylar's lazy loading startup in order to resolve this.  What would be really useful is if I could get you to try out a test build.  I'll post here when that's ready.

Scott, I've fixed up the startup order, removed one of the earlye startups and added some failure handling.  I can no longer reproduce the exception.  Could you please try 0.4.3.1 dev build and see if you can still reproduce this?  The update site is:

  download.eclipse.org/technology/mylar/update-site/dev (3.2 only)

Scott: please hold off on using this build until I post to this report again.  I just managed to find a way to reproduce the exception again (by ensuring that no Mylar Java stuff is loaded on startup, then doing having it load laziy).  It still causes no bad behavior, but I really want to get rid of this.

Mik,

No problem I will hold up until you are ready.  I will be home tonight after 9 pm EST and can test it.  if not I can easily test it tomorrow during the day EST.

Scott
Scott, go ahead and try that 0.4.3.1 build I posted and let me know how it goes.

Mik,

Executing all the tests I did before I am unable to reproduce the problem that causes a stack trace in the log.  In addition to this the Mylar initialization appears to be faster.  I am not noticing the eclipse UI hanging as much any more.  

You can close this issue I will continue to play with 0.4.3.1 until 0.4.4 is released.  If I notice this issue again I will reopen the bug again.  
Great job.

Scott

Great!  And yes, the additional laziness should make initialization a bit faster.  Feel free to continue using 0.4.3.1 (I use Mylar from HEAD), but please reopen this report if you see the exception again.  

This reminded me that we could get another startup performance boost from improving initialization of the task list, so I've opened up a report for that: bug 118443.
